lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Gwau Gwiel ko jqn kY nIko hoq pIr imit jwie lIk imtq n pyKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ghaau Ghaail Ko Jatan Kai Neeko Hota , Peer Miti Jaai Leek Mitat N Paykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the wound gets cured with medicine and the pain also vanishes, but the scar of the wound is never seen to vanish.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Pwty AMbro sIAwie puin EFIAq nwgo qau n hoie qaU QygrI pryKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dhaatay Anbaro Seeaai Pouni Aoddheeata , Naago Tau N Hoi Taoo Daygaree Paraykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a torn cloth stitched and worn does not bare the body but the seam of the stitch is visible and conspicuous.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy tUtY bwsnu svwr dyq hY TTyro igrq n pwnI pY gTIlo ByK ByKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tootai Baasanu Savaar Dayt Hai Tthatthayro , Girat N Paanee Pai Gattheelo Bhaykh Bhaykheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a broken utensil is repaired by coppersmith and even the water does not leak from it, but it is repaired form stays.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crin ibmuK duK dyiK puin srn ghy punIq pY klMku lyK lyKIAY ]419]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charani Bimoukh Doukh Daykhi Pouni , Saran Gahay Pouneet Pai Kalanku Laykh Laykheeai ?419?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a disciple who has turned away from the holy feet of the True Guru comes back to the Guru's refuge when he feels the pain of his actions. Although he is freed of his sins and becomes pious, yet the .blemish of his apostasy remains.  (419)
